lines.gurmukhi: mwnsr iqAwig Awn sr jwie bYTy hMsu Kwie jl jMq hMs bMsih ljwveI
lines.transliteration_english: Maanasar Tiaagi Aan Sar Jaai Baitthay Hansu , Khaai Jal Jant Hans Bansahi Lajaavaee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: If a swan leaves lake Mansarover and resides in a pond, starts eating living beings from the pond like a heron, he will shame the species of swans.

lines.gurmukhi: sill ibCoh Bey jIAq rhY jau mIn kpt snyh kY snyhI n khwveI
lines.transliteration_english: Salil Bichhoh Bhaay Jeeat Rahai Jau Meena , Kapat Sanayh Kai Sanayhee N Kahaavaee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: If a fish survives outside water, then its love for water will be considered false and it would not be called as beloved of water.

lines.gurmukhi: ibnu Gn bUMd jau Anq jl pwn krY cwqiRk sMqwn ibKY lCnu lgwveI
lines.transliteration_english: Binu Ghan Boond Jau Anat Jal Paan Karai , Chaatrik Santaan Bikhai Lachhanu Lagaavaee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: If a rain-bird satiates its thirst with a drop of water other than the swati drop, he would stigmatise his family.

lines.gurmukhi: crn kml Ail gurisK moK huie Awn dyv syvk huie mukiq n pwveI ]463]
lines.transliteration_english: Charan Kamal Ali Gursikh Mokh Hui , Aan Dayv Sayvak Hui Moukati N Paavaee ?463?

Shabad OS B.translation: A devoted disciple of the True Guru preaches the teachings of the True Guru and achieves emancipation. But a disciple who gives up his love for the True Guru and bows before other gods, self.-made saints and sages and worships them; his love with Guru is
